page.title: 01BRADNOP AND ITS SURROUNDINGS
page.content: Bradnop is a small village, near Leek, bordering onto the Staffordshire Moorlands. The village forms the focus of a predominantly rural study area. Apart from the cluster of about twenty buildings in the village the only other settlements consist of dispersed farmsteads. The land-use of the area is dominated by farmland with most being either for grazing or silage. The relief of the area is varied: to the south of Bradnop the land is flat whereas as one travels north the land rises sharply to form a ridge running in an east-west direction. Communications in the area are poor with only the A523 (Ashbourne Rd.) and a few minor roads to be found. After a period of decline Bradnop has experienced recent building development in terms of some private houses.
